climbs.name: Settlers Line
climbs.fa: Garrett Weaver, Andrew Shipley and Kyle Kent

content.description:
Settlers Line is an excellent offwidth and chimney route. The rock is bomber throughout the route. The summit is only as big as a living room and dead flat.

p1:Follow low angle hand crack to hard part right at the end.(100ft)5.9

p2:Face climb up to bolt 10 feet above the anchor. Then climb straight up over a small roof via a #1 camalot crack. Then traverse 5 feet to the left into a #4 crack. Follow this crack as it grows into a #5 to #6 and ends with a layback 8 inch crack to good ledge with a anchor.(100ft)5.10

p3:Follow splitter 6 inch crack with a bolt at 25 feet for 60 feet to another ledge.(60ft)5.10+

p4:Excellent squeeze chinmney with 11 bolts. No trad gear possible.(160ft)5.10

p5:Climb squeeze chimney 10 feet to bolt and continue up chimney to big ledge.(100ft)5.9

p6:Climb soild white face up to red corner and top out.(100ft)5.9
content.location: SE Face of Mount Johnson. Rappel route.

climbs.name: The Force Boyle.
climbs.fa: Bill Ohran, Robbie Colber, Dan Snyder.

content.description:
1st pitch is long with the crux just about half way.

Pitch 5 and 6 haven't been freed yet and more than likely the 6th will be the true crux pitch if it goes free.
content.protection:
Nuts: 1-2 sets (offsets useful)

Cams: 2 each .33-4" - 2 extra 1.5-3" - 1 each 4.5-6"

1 70m or 2 60m ropes.
content.location: Check the new "Zion climbing - Free and Clean" guide book for more info.

content.description:
Many blockhead moves were committed this day. Including a trundle following pitch 1, which tacks on a solid "+" to grade. I even had a camera up there but never took shots of the line - yep - it's that good! It is worth doing if you are up there with some time left for climbing.

P1 5.10+  Wide jams to an offwidth bulge.

P2 5.9+   Mostly hand jams in the corner.

P2 has a single bolt anchor - another blockhead moment.
content.protection: Double set fingers to fists, #5 and #6 may be good to have for P1's crux.
content.location: On the Southeast facing wall of Mt Johnson. Climbers left of the gully system left of Force Boyle.
